boardgame.name: Sailing Aboard the Widow (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A single mast thrusts skyward like a proud lance, assailing the grey heavens as the good ship Widow ploughs through the waves. The storm-blasted sail billows in the wind, dragging the ship across the seething sea which readily cleaves before its grim figurehead. Standing at the helm is sullen-faced Saamo Hilhaarja, captain of Widow and master of the sea. Despite their advanced age and a reputation far from untarnished, there are no mariners more accomplished than Saamo and his crew. No matter the weather or the dangers of the journey, Widow always sails.

This eventure is suitable for any level PCs and can be used with any size group. It has also been designed to be easily adapted to virtually any GM’s campaign.

Sailing Aboard the Widow is set in and around the Duchy of Ashlar but is easily adaptable to almost any fantasy city.

boardgame.name: Crusader's Solo Handbook
Crusaders Solo Handbook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

These solo role-play rules are designed to make use of Castles & Crusades SiegeEngine mechanics.

The rules provide oracles that fit in well with the games core dice mechanics, so you don't have to break the spirit of the game every time you call on the solo rules, it all feels like C&C.

There is also advice on playing published modules using the solo rules, making combat more narrative. Narrative Combat allows you to bypass all the roll to hit/roll damage for minor skirmishes that are normally used to set the tone of an adventure and to wear down a party.

Narrative combat makes these skirmishes more exciting and shorter.

There is also advice on getting started with solo playing, for those that have never tried it.

boardgame.name: Davy Jones' Locker
boardgame.description:
A VP-collection game with a unique moving-target mechanic that provides a good amount of player interaction, a bit of take-that and just the right amount of luck.
Each player controls two ships: The pirate ship can bury treasure, which becomes a target for other players to dig out, and can attack other ships to steal from them. The sailing ship must move onto landmarks on the board using limited movement dictated by a “wind” die, while being also a target for attacks.
Both the treasure and the actions players can use come from chits drawn from a bag throughout the game.
You win by having the most points in hand, buried under your treasure markers on the board, or from collected landmarks.
The game can be played from 2 to up to 6 players.

—description from the publisher

AWARDS
Finalist in the 2020 Geekway to the West game design contest (convention/contest cancelled).

boardgame.name: Port Nyanzaru
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do you wish Tomb of Annihilation had more content and maps? Do you wish there was more jungle in your jungle adventure? Are you too busy to prepare all this yourself?

Then this is the product for you!

What it included?


10 colorful maps, including battlemap variants for Executioner's Run, a random city encounter map (day & night variants), a battlemap for the Grand Coliseum, an alternate exploration map, an alternate DM map of Chult, and a nighttime map in the Warehouse District for discrete and secret encounters!
Two new sidequests, with a city storm drain map and a long-running plot involving albino dwarf clans, assassins, and political intrigue!
Two additional adventure hooks for later adventures to continue your campaign after the Death Curse has been dealt with.

boardgame.name: Needle's Bones
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do you wish Tomb of Annihilation had more content and maps? Do you wish there was more jungle in your jungle adventure? Are you too busy to prepare all this yourself?

Then this is the product for you!

What it included?


23 colorful maps, including battlemap variants for Needle's Bones, several random encounter maps for out in the wilderness of Chult, and maps for the sidequest adventures!
Two new sidequests, each with maps, encounters, treasures, and interesting stories that add to your Chultan adventure experience.
Three new pieces of art, all of them clues that tie into a mystery in one of the sidequests.

boardgame.name: Four Islands
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:


The Isle of Massive Crustaceans sees the party square off against a sorcerer-tyrant and his monstrous pets in a tropical setting, near Cesaire in Cube World, near Madagascar in LotFP.
The Isle of the Lava Trolls is a volcanic island-fortress north of Nephilidia or Iceland
The Isle of Fifty Fingers allows the party to take control of a small skirmish force for a mini-wargame in the Peacock Isles/India.
The Isle of the Spawn King places the titular ruler in the center of a ring of horrible mutant slaves bent on making the party join them, on an island deep within Spawn Lake in Broceliande--or in Siberia.

boardgame.name: Welcome to the Island
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Welcome to the Island features four all-new scenarios that can launch brand new story arcs, add intriguing complications to your existing arcs, or explode across you[r] gaming table as exciting one-shots. Each scenario includes custom hooks for agents, burgers, cloaks, gangs, and mystics, making it easy for you to bring the action to your players no matter what kind of trouble they like getting into.

boardgame.name: Retropunk
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Retropunk is a tabletop roleplaying game where the players embody characters in a futuristic hybrid reality—where the digital and physical have merged. Everyone experiences a world beyond augmented reality through their neurochip, tech implanted at birth. The player characters hacked their neurochips to traverse this hybrid reality without being monitored by the system.

The player characters cloak themselves in anonymity to combat the corporatocracy that controls urban sprawls across countries and continents. They snatch resources away from those in power and use their gains to fuel their resistance. As the rebellion grows, they take on more powerful factions.

boardgame.name: Alpina
boardgame.description:
Each player has a tourist and a party of 3 guides and 7 shooters. There is also a poacher and a stage coach for each player. The goal of the game is for the tourists to reach one of two summits in enemy territory. The task of the party is to help their own tourist and prevent the opponent tourist to reach his goal.

The different game pieces have different methods to move or to take prisoners:

Tourist: move and take: 1 step in any direction. If the Tourist is threatened, he may take the place of one of his guides or shooters 1 step away from him. The guide or shooter is eliminated from the game.

Guide: moves 1 or 2 steps in any direction, takes 1 step from mountain to valley or vice-versa.

Shooter: moves 1 step in any direction, takes 1 step from mountain to valley.

Poacher: moves 2 or 3 steps in any direction, may take only 1 shooter (per game!) 1 step in any direction, may ot use the coach.

Stage Coach: moves up to 3 steps on the red roads and takes all enemy pieces on the way if they are not standing directly behind each other. May transport friendly pieces up to 2 steps.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Blood Rage: Mystic Troll
boardgame.description:
This was a Kickstarter Exclusive Stretch Goal to the original KS (2015) and has been available at conventions and other various sales by CMON.
It was also available in the Promos Box during the Digital KS (2018) as a resculpt and renamed (Seer Troll)

- new, yet unwrapped and NEVER used - box has slight traces of tears, but the content inside is in perfect mint condition - ask for shipping quotation - ps: international shipping is kind of reasonable (with Mondial Relay) to France, Germany, Belgium, Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Portugal, Luxembourg, Austria.

boardgame.name: Black Book
boardgame.description:
“Black Book” is a dark RPG Adventure, based on Slavic mythology, in which you play as a young sorceress. Battle evil forces, aid commonfolk and travel across the rural countryside, where humans live alongside mythological creatures.

Black Book is a unique opportunity to get acquainted with the world of Northern Slavic mythology, shaped by its history and tradition. The game was developed by the people who grew up with these folk tales, and consulted with historians and anthropologists to make sure the game’s narrative accurately represents the beliefs of their ancestors.

Features

Experience the haunting tale of myth and mystery, set in the backdrop of towns and villages of late XIXth Century
7 Chapters to get through - each with their own main unfolding narrative and multiple side-stories
Battle the evil spirits with the card-collecting, deck-building battle system
Meet all kinds of companions on your way through Cherdyn - from a war-battered soldier to a talking cat with a dry sense of humor
Recruit demonic forces to your cause and use their power to grow stronger
Dive into the world of Slavic legend and folklore, and test your newfound knowledge its mythology


Source: The Game Press Kit.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 Gamescom Best Nintendo Console Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Lumberjack's Dynasty
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).




In Lumberjack’s Dynasty you can build your own empire around the fascinating resource of wood. Forests full of trees are waiting to be cultivated, harvested and turned into different products to make your business grow.

Fire, tools and weapons: Since the beginning of mankind, wood has been amongst the most important resources – its strength and versatility providing the basis not only for cooking and heating, but also weapons, tools, furniture and houses amongst many other useful things.

Away from bright city lights with its manifold entertainment opportunities, you will be back in the middle of nature’s most beautiful sceneries and deeply experiencing the world of a real lumberjack.

You are starting at a run-down logger camp which you inherited from your father – dedicated to bringing it back to old glory. To get there, a ton of work is waiting for you: From repairing your home as well as the logger camp itself, getting the old sawmill working again and, the core of it all: felling trees, transporting them to the mill and processing the wood into various products.

If that weren’t enough work already, you will also need to take care of your family life while growing your company and transforming both into a successful dynasty.

Get ready for your logger's life in Lumberjack’s Dynasty! This new game based on the successful “DYNASTY” concept offers a unique mix of a life simulation, role-playing and a classical woodcutting simulation game.

Grab your chainsaw now and start your own Lumberjack Dynasty!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Unearthed
boardgame.description:
A three-dimensional treasure hunt on an multi-layered island.
Lasercut with magnetic tiles to hold tools and secret artifacts.

Dig through the several layers to uncover artifacts needed to recover treasures:

terrain
tools
strata.


Uncover tools needed to dig deeper.

Terrain includes fields, forest, rocks, ruins and swamps.

Somewhat akin to the Treasure of Oak Island.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Whale Riders: El juego de cartas
Whale Riders: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
While preparing for the winter, the whale riders were surprised by a sudden drop in temperature. The Ice Coast will freeze early and will make the journey for supplies even more dangerous than usual.

The riders bond together and journey as a group one final time from port to port. Many supplies are needed for their clans, and the riders agree to band together and commit to sharing one big consignment in each port.

Soon, however, it becomes apparent that the raiders’ preferences for the offered consignments differ greatly. In each port, the to-ing and fro-ing begins anew to close the most preferred deal…

In Whale Riders: The Card Game, you ride alongside others to buy goods along the Ice Coast, sometimes working together with others only to become competitors again when a better proposition comes along. A reimplimentation of Reiner Knizia's classic card game Trendy.

boardgame.name: Police Chase
boardgame.description:
In Police Chase thrilling missions, powerful cars and fighting crime will be your routine! Whether it’s issuing offenders with parking and speeding tickets or thwarting terrorist plots and other crimes — only one thing counts in your job: Guarantee safety in your beat!

Meet with informers, shadow suspects, chase perps and handle time-critical missions. Superfast action, a captivating story and a big, open game world call for courage, skill and fast reflexes! In Police Chase it all depends on you!

Features


Begin your police career in an absorbing campaign with 15 tense missions.
Be ready for the speed and heart-pumping action that awaits on 15 dangerous routes!
A wide range of detailed vehicles with varying HP await.
Your beat is a large, open 3D world with highways, country roads, and industrial estates.
In free-play mode, protect the streets from criminal masterminds and solve 80 different side quests to move up from beat cop to the chief of police.


Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.description: Issue 2 of this fanzine covering AD&D, D&D and MERP.

boardgame.name: The Silent Battalion: Enemy Pack 2 – Five Leagues from the Borderlands
boardgame.description:
In the dark of night, the Silent Battalion marches to reclaim the world from the living.

This Enemy Pack for Five Leagues From the Borderlands slots right into any campaign and offers:

A new Enemy type featuring skeleton soldiers with 8 entries.
Rules explaining the new Enemy type, how fighting them works and any game changes needed.
5 new Personalities to do battle with.
3 new Skills to obtain.


Whether you are looking for some variation, something new to paint or a chance to use some skeletons on the table, this expansion pack has what you need.

For the Five Leagues 2nd edition rule set.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Area F2
boardgame.description: In Area F2, the first Close-Quarters Battle (AKA CQB) shooting game on mobile, players fight over ultra-realistic environments as attacker and defender, playing as one of a wide selection of agents, each with own their special ability. All roofs and walls can be reinforced or destroyed, challenging players' skills and tactics as every wall may become a potential entry point.

boardgame.name: Roads Well Traveled: An Expansion Pack for Five Leagues from the Borderlands
boardgame.description:
This expansion for Five Leagues From the Borderlands dramatically expands the Roadside Encounters mechanic in the core rules.

The worlds of fantasy tales are always filled with interesting, memorable and occasionally dangerous travelers and our campaign games should be no different.

The existing tables have been expanded to include new results, allowing for more variety and more things the person might want from you.

Some existing results have been tweaked to be more interesting as well.

Players have remarked positively on the ability to make Friends with travelers, but they haven’t been that easy to get an advantage from.

We’ve updated that system to make it a bit more helpful to the player.

There are also more opportunities to have roadside encounters now.

Most excitingly this pack adds 30 unique encounters ranging from a treasure hunter joining you for a bit to the local drunkard wanting someone to hang out with.

These new encounters can grant you rewards, new problems to deal with or a welcome respite fro the merciless world.

Some are simply events that happen, while others give you decisions to make.

The new rules, updated tables and unique encounters are all integrated into the new encounter table, allowing you to take full advantage of this pack.

Players who have their rules printed in a binder can simply replace the Roadside Encounter check pages in the rulebook with the pages from this supplement.

The pack is written for the 2nd edition rules, though it should be usable with 1st edition with very little adjustment.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Inventure Quest
boardgame.description:
Inventure Quest is a create-your-own role-playing game for 2-6 players where you make your own quest, characters, and challenges as you go along. A cooperative game with infinite replayability, Inventure Quest tests your wits and imagination… Your survival comes down to how well you know your characters and fellow players.

The game utilizes a card and voting system similar to Dixit or Codenames to determine whether player actions are successful or not. In Inventure Quest, each turn the active player faces a challenge created by the previous player. They're dealt 5 options to choose from, for how their player would solve the problem. Each option is represented by an action and an object, for example 'Run + House'. The active player reflects on their character sheet and then secretly decides which of the 5 actions their character would do. Then, the other players vote. If they vote the same way as the active player, the quest advances.

Much of the challenge and enjoyment of the game lies in crafting stories and creating the world in which the quest takes place; the more detailed your storytelling, the more likely players are to decide similarly about which action is best. This means that storytelling isn't just for flair-- it's essential to the game!

Players create their own characters, challenges, quests, and worlds. Your games can be scifi, fantasy, realistic, anything. With endless possibilities, you could play a trillion times and never have a similar adventure!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Bob's Burgers
boardgame.description: It's Monopoly with a "Bob's Burgers" twist! Same as original Monopoly, with all of the board spaces, cards, and tokens done over in a Bob's Burgers theme. Includes 6 collectible pewter tokens.

boardgame.name: FTL: 2448 The Game of Role-Playing in Space (1st Ed)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Faster Than Light 2448 is a role playing game of planetary exploration and adventure in the not so far future.

You will become a human or alien in a time of exploration and corporate expansion. Fortunes can be made and lost by the seldom considered individual. You will travel to worlds of wealth or poverty, work hells or worlds built on ideals. Aliens and robots will be your friends as you travel the frontiers of settled space.

In FTL you will find no Galactic Empires of Star Kings, Dreadnaughts, Battle Cruisers, or planet destroying Galactic Rangers. You will find real people interacting with alien cultures under the watchful eyes of a police agency dedicated to fairness and peace.

Welcome to 2448.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

boardgame.name: Game of Thrones Trivia Game: Seasons 5-8 Expansion
boardgame.description:
Complete your battle for the Iron Throne with the Game of Thrones: The Trivia Game Season 5-8 Expansion! In the only game that matters, knowledge can be deadlier than a sword, and now the battle intensifies with the addition of a fifth player and over 1,200 new questions to test your wits. As you struggle to gain control of key locations, forge alliances, and earn favor, a sharp mind will mean the difference between victory and defeat. Put your knowledge to the test and claim your throne!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Alphabet Dungeon
boardgame.description:
Alphabet Dungeon is a two to four player game where a group of stalwart adventurers go on a quest for treasure tiles. You will be exploring a mysterious dungeon, fighting monsters and searching for treasure tiles. In this dungeon the treasures are letters and your goal is to solve all the words on your quest. As you explore the dungeon and defeat monsters you gain more letters to help solve more words. The player that completes his/her entire quest of words wins the game. During your exploration you can visit the bazaar and purchase vowels to help you complete your quest.

VICTORY CONDITIONS:
When a player completes all the quest words on his/her quest card, they win the game. The Bonus word is used in case of a tie where both players complete their quest card on the same turn, the player that has also completed the bonus word would end up being the winner. If both players complete all words and the bonus word on the same turn, then both players share the win.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Master of Wills: Overlord Game Variant
boardgame.description:
The Overlord Master of Wills game variant is a mind-bending experience where the control of your fate no longer resides in your hands. This thrilling new experience forces all players into uncomfortable situations which require a different style of strategy to navigate. The Overlord has taken the City of Novus by storm… can you defeat your opponent while fending off this new unstoppable force?

The Overlord deck comes with 20 Overlord cards and 1 Help/Rule card.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Master of Wills: Core Faction Expansion Set
boardgame.description:
This expansion set brings new Action, Epic and Legendary cards to each of the 4 core Factions. Expanding the Factions with new options provides exciting and unique power combinations that are not available in the base game. How will you utilize these different characters and abilities to crush your opponents?

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Master of Wills: Dawnlight Expansion Faction Deck
Master of Wills: Shadowcell Expansion Faction Deck

boardgame.name: Restaurounds
boardgame.description:
In Restaurounds each player owns their own small sushi restaurant. Players compete to buy better equipment, hire skilled chefs and fulfill orders.

On their turn players move one of their chef meeples around their personal rondel, activate a tile and perform the action(s) printed on it.

Players can upgrade their rondel by buying new tiles from a central market which gives them more options and efficiency.

Players also have access to powerful one-time actions that can be very beneficial in the right moment.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bloat
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Villagers disappear. Tracks lead to an underground temple of bacchanalian frenzy, reeking of rot, offal and bile. Find them and sate your hunger in Bloat, a gluttunous one-page dungeon.

boardgame.name: Master of Wills: Alphaguard Fringe War Neutral Pack
boardgame.description:
The world has split into four core Factions. As influence shifts, new fringe Factions have jointed the war with intentionss of changing the tide. Advanced technologies have emerged causing a major rise in conflict. Alphagurard is fortifying their ranks and will seek out these new inovations to preserve authority.

12 New Cards + 1 Holo Card

—description from the publisher

boardgame.description:
The world has split into four core Factions. As influence shifts, new fringe Factions have joined the war with intentions of changing the tide. 12 New Cards + 1 Holo Card

boardgame.name: Arvaa, mitä ajattelen?!
boardgame.description:
Players pick two cards, adjective and noun, and try to figure out third,suitable word for both of these words. If two players come up with the same word, both get points.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Roskis
boardgame.description:
Players must open the lid of the garbage can, put in the garbage and try not to let the flies escape. The Garbage can vibrates and throws out those light flies. Game is over when all the flies have escaped. Winner is the one who let least numbers of flies escape.

—user summary

Not to be confused with the Lautapelit.fi Finnish edition of Ab in die Tonne, which came out the same year with the same name.

boardgame.name: Scooby-Doo! The Board Game
boardgame.description:
Ruh-roh, Shaggy! There's a monster on the loose, and it's scaring everyone out of town! It's up to the Mystery Inc. gang to stop them! Scooby-Doo! The Board Game is a co-operative family game for 1-5 players that brings the beloved cartoon series to life with amazing miniatures of the whole gang.

Players take on the role of Scooby-Doo, Fred, Velma, Daphne or Shaggy, and ride the Mystery Machine around town, building traps to catch the villains before they frighten all the citizens away — but just like in our favorite episodes, even the best plans can go awry as the monster, which is controlled by the game itself, may make a move the players never expected!

Each member of Mystery, Inc. has their own unique, special ability to help them during the game, and they'll need all the help they can get because the villains all operate differently as well! The gang can succeed only if they coordinate together as a group.

Scooby-Doo! The Board Game has three levels of difficulty (easy/medium/hard) and special rules for playing as a two-player game or a solo game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hooch Stooges: Promo – Origins of Don
boardgame.description: A promo card given away at conventions. “Until the end of turn, if you would get busted, draw a card instead.”

listing.notes: Shipping free in the USA. International shipping $3.

boardgame.name: Beach Life
boardgame.description:
While building a giant sandcastle, you notice that you are sharing the beach with a variety of sea-dwellers. You discard your bucket and space to give the creatures a helping hand. Get points for helping each animal, most points wins.

Beach Life is a 'roll and write' game. One player rolls the dice and each player decides how they will use the dice rolls on their own board. One dice determines which mini game you are working on, another determines the number you'll use within that game. The number on the third dice can be used five times in the game as a bonus action.

The game finishes when one player has taken three 'no throws'.

Beach Life is a 'Placemat' game - a game contained entirely within an A3 placemat (including the rules). Just add three standard D6 dice.

On the reverse side of each placemat is a second game - Castaway.

Both games have a desert island theme.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Castaway
boardgame.description:
You are stranded on a desert island. Use the resources at your disposal to make life more comfortable and/or increase your chances of rescue. Get points for developing your island. But will you try to make a home on this tropical paradise or do everything you can to get out of there?

Castaway is a 'roll and write' game. One player rolls the dice and each player decides how they will use the dice rolls on their own board. The dice show the coordinates on the map and indicate the area you must work on each turn. The choice of action within that area is yours. Will you cut down trees or plant new ones? Will you build a shelter or plunder a shipwreck? The choice is yours.

The game finishes when one player is rescued, abandoned or becomes self-sustained.

Castaway is a 'Placemat' game - a game contained entirely within an A3 placemat (including the rules). Just add two standard D6 dice.

On the reverse side of each placemat is a second game - Beach Life.

Both games have a desert island theme.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The End of Kings: Core Rules for 17th Century Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to The End of Kings! The land has been ripped apart by a plague of madness, split by religious division and torn asunder by the blood-drenched battle for sovereignty over the nation itself. Enemy insurgents threaten to stir up rebellion and, in their rural hamlets, common folk cower in dread of the supernatural terrors from beyond the Veil.

Within this book is everything you need to play the game from character creation, skills and challenges, spells, creatures and weapons, to constructing buildings, creating magic items such as potions and magic circles. So arm yourself with matchlock and mortuary sword! Rewrite history!

boardgame.name: The End of Kings Quick-Start Rules
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the End of Kings Quick Start guide, set in an alternative 17th Century Britain. It contains information about creating characters, running encounters, a little bit about skills and challenges, spell casting and how to successfully run a game. It also contains a new full adventure for new players.

Cunning folk brew their potions as the court warlocks expand the horizons of science and spellcraft. Outlaws roam the uncharted lands while vagabonds ply their trade in city streets. This book gives a flavour of the world which marks the End of Kings!

boardgame.name: The End of Kings Character Creation
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Presented here in this little booklet is the complete guide to creating a character together with some of the main character classes to be found in the main game. Better than this, it also contains all the character sheets used in the game which you are free to print copies off for play. This book gives you a flavour of the types of characters you get to play and gives you a chance to generate a character. Once you have done this you can get the Quickstart or even the Core Rule book and start having fun!

boardgame.name: The Nature of the Beast
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The last wolf of England was hunted to exitinction over a hundred years ago so when a woodsman discovered the carcass of a sheep in Hobbs Hill woods he believed some supernatural beast was at large. Lord Perfleet was preoccupied with other matters. His daughter had gone missing and with the news of slaughtered livestock he was faced with the stark prospect of his own child being a victim of the creature. He summoned a priest; he would know what to do.

boardgame.name: The Raven Stone
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As night descended the undead entered the camp drawn by the stolen jewel. They feasted on the merchant and his guard before huddling round the stone until the break of dawn when they collapsed in a grotesque heap.

This is a old school fantasy adventure for new players with low level characters.

boardgame.name: Roundforest
boardgame.description:
Roundforest is a family game for 2-4 players. Despite the fairy-tale theme, it requires a great deal of strategic thinking. You play as poor lads who compete for the favor of the beautiful princess. The winner will be the one who brings her the emerald ring of the Forest Spirit residing in the Roundforest. But the Spirit is only willing to hand over the ring for three golden apples – and if certain other conditions are also met.

The task is a challenging one. To begin with, nobody knows where the Forest Spirit is hiding. Then, it is not so easy to find your way in this enchanted forest: whenever you arrive at a clearing (a game space), it makes a quadrant turn clockwise! This constantly changes players’ movement options.

Of course, golden apples are not found in the forest. These are acquired by smart planning and a series of actions. You will collect various objects; use them if needed, trade them with the Fairy, or find a magic well to convert them into something else. This way you may come by some golden apples too.
You will encounter various fairy-tale characters living in the Roundforest, such as a magic steed, a witch, a goblin, a beggar, a wealthy merchant, a puzzled sculptor, a bandit – or even the Devil itself. Some of these creatures are friendly, while others are hostile, trying to make your life difficult. The former might help you in return for a little favor, and the latter can be defeated if you deal with them the right way.

The game field is built randomly of 32 octagonal forest tiles. Components include 12 fairy-tale character cards, a large pack of object tokens, action discs, copper and silver coins, a fairy board, personal boards (haversacks) and a draw bag. The game provides approximately 1 hour playing time. It is recommended above 8 years of age.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Ez a 2-4 fő által játszható családi játék a meseszerű tematika ellenére stratégiai gondolkodást igényel. A játékosok szegénylegényeket irányítanak, akik a szépséges királykisasszony kegyeiért versengenek. Az nyeri el a kezét, aki megszerzi számára a híres Kerekerdő szellemének smaragdgyűrűjét. Az Erdőszellem azonban csak 3 aranyalmáért válik meg a gyűrűtől, sőt egyéb feltételei is vannak.

Ez nem is olyan egyszerű feladat. Egyrészt, induláskor még senki nem tudja, hol rejtőzködik az Erdőszellem. Másrészt, ez egy elvarázsolt erdő, ahol nagyon könnyű eltévedni: amikor valaki egy tisztásra (játékmezőre) lép, az azonnal 90 fokkal elfordul alatta! A forgással egyidejűleg a haladási lehetőségek is folyamatosan változnak.

Természetesen az áhított aranyalmák nem teremnek az erdőben. Ezekhez ügyes tervezéssel, különböző akciók sorozatával juthatnak hozzá a játékosok. Különböző tárgyakat gyűjthetnek, ezeket aztán felhasználhatják, elcsereberélhetik a Tündérrel, vagy néhány csodakút segítségével átváltoztathatják más tárgyakká – és ennek eredményeként aranyalmához is juthatnak.
Ez az erdő közel sem néptelen! Aki sokat bolyong benne, találkozhat többek között egy táltos paripával, egy boszorkánnyal, egy kobolddal, egy koldussal, egy gazdag kereskedővel, egy tanácstalan szobrásszal, de útonállóval, sőt magával az ördöggel is! E mesebeli karakterek némelyike jószándékú, míg mások ellenségesek, és igyekeznek megakadályozni a küldetés teljesítését. Az előbbiek némi ellenszolgáltatás fejében segítik a játékost, az utóbbiakat pedig bizonyos eszközökkel le lehet győzni.

A játéktér 32 nyolcszögletű erdőlapkából épül fel, véletlenszerűen. A játék tartalmaz továbbá 12 mesebeli karakterkártyát, tárgykorongokat, akciókorongokat, pénzérméket, egy tündértáblát, személyes táblákat (tarisznya) és egy húzózsákot. A játékidő kb. 1 óra. 8 éves kor fölött ajánlott.

—description from the publisher (Hungarian)

boardgame.name: Clearbarrow Village
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blackleg Chronicles Clearbarrow Village 5E Supplement decribes the village and inhabitants the players may encounter within the village.
The supplement containes detailed information about the inhabitants and motivations of the village folk which dwell in the village. The Non-player characters contained within this tome have their own statistics that will make them more interesting and fun to campaign with.

This ready to use village setting can be adopted to work into any campaign. Providing a quick and fun location when the party wants to "go back to town".

boardgame.name: Psi & Tau
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the thirty years since the advent of enhanced humans with powers and mutation-based abilities, the world has had time to adjust to this new reality. People have come accept—and even admire—powered humans and those with capabilities once found only in the realm of science fiction. No one finds it impossible to believe in people that can fly, turn into lightning, bend steel with their bare hands, or read minds. While the public accepts the existence of powers, most people remain uncomfortable with certain aspects of this brave new world. Two areas in particular have proven difficult for people to tolerate: telepathy and sentient machines.
boardgame.rpgseries: Official Handbook of the Amazing Universe

boardgame.name: On the First Night
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This festive adventure pits a horde of goblins against an evil, fire-breathing raindeer riding, elf from the northern wastes named Eothanta. The PCs play as a band of goblins sent on urgent missions by their dark goblin lord Grapfrut. The adventure includes riddles, combat, social role-play and some evil princesses.

The adventure is system agnostic and can used in any system as no stats are included. Several unique to module rules exist in this module - such as a the card game North Pole which uses dice, or the flight of the goblin war-ball, which also utilizes a bespoke d6 system.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: How to be a Great Game Master

boardgame.name: Free Spacer
boardgame.description:
A Sandbox Starship Tabletop Roleplaying Game

From the back of the book:

Adventure. Investigation. Science!

Free Spacer is a contemporary science fiction tabletop roleplaying game. It leverages the newest space sciences, takes into account biotechnology, and brings the internet to the rim of the quadrant.

As a Free Spacer, you’re a crewmember on a small starship, an outsider, and a contractor. You’ll explore new worlds, investigate dangers, negotiate contracts, operate your starship, and do science!

As the Gamemaster, you have a wealth of tools at your disposal to build whole worlds and manage the machinations of sector factions in the ongoing Cold War. You’ll be able to easily run conflicts, spaceflight, fabrication projects, and other challenges, while quickly generating new locations and characters.

Play to find out how the crew gets the job done, the choice they make, the rules they break, and the length will go for their Patrons.

Welcome Aboard, Free Spacer

boardgame.name: Free Spacer Resources
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This document presents numerous print-and-play, blank forms for use in the game. The primary contents are ships' logs blanks.

boardgame.name: Tsukiji: Playmat
boardgame.description:
Rubberized playmat in grip neoprene (2mm) 90 x 90 cm with thematic art for Tsukiji up to 4 players.
It replaces the original board.

boardgame.name: Sector Archives: Player Version
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The Sector Archives is a booklet of prepared setting and campaign materials. It has everything you need to start your campaign with little additional prep. Every archive includes setting materials, a beginning contract, and all the locations and characters you need to run those scenarios. Some have additional worlds, settlements, and contracts to help you take your campaign to the next level.

boardgame.name: Sector Archives: Gamemaster Version
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The Sector Archives is a booklet of prepared setting and campaign materials. It has everything you need to start your campaign with little additional prep. Every archive includes setting materials, a beginning contract, and all the locations and characters you need to run those scenarios. Some have additional worlds, settlements, and contracts to help you take your campaign to the next level.

Metal coins for Tsukiji in personalized cloth bag.

- 14 coins valued ¥1
- 9 coins valued ¥5
- 9 coins valued ¥10

boardgame.name: Gatekeeper (Issue 1 - 1987)
To Catch a Thief
boardgame.description:
Gatekeeper
Issue 1
1987

Includes the system-agnostic scenario "To Catch a Thief" (listed as "To Feed a Thief" in the Table of Contents)

boardgame.name: Tiny Epic Pirates: Curse of Amdiak
boardgame.description:
In Tiny Epic Pirates: Curse of Amdiak, rumors of the unthinkable are spreading quickly around the islands. Rumors of dead pirates returning to the sea... aboard an ominous ghost ship helmed by the legendary pirate Amdiak...

Several new game elements are added to play including cursed gold, a ghost ship that haunts the players as they try to steal the cursed gold, ancient relics, haunted map cards and even skeleton crew!

Players gain cursed gold by stealing it from the ghost ship and attacking other pirates who possess it. Cursed gold can be traded for an ancient relic said to hold ashes of Amdiak. Bury this relic and break the Curse of Amdiak!

If the ghost ship finds catches you though, your captain becomes cursed and you lose your cursed gold. Once cursed you will be able to recruit powerful skeleton crew to mindlessly obey your wicked command!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Nemesis: Lockdown
네메시스: 락다운
boardgame.description:
Nemesis Lockdown is the first stand alone expansion to Nemesis. During the game, players will be taken to a totally new location - a secret base on Mars, represented by a multi level board. Lockdown will retain the highly cinematic, semi-co-op experience of the original game, while introducing a lot of new, fresh mechanics.

During the tense gameplay, you and your fellow players will gather items, explore different rooms and use your actions, craft, run, and fight other species. At the same time, every player will try to complete their secret objective, that will grant them victory... Sometimes at the expense of others.

Some of the new mechanics are:
- Multi-level base with stairs and elevators
- Advanced computer actions
- CSS hatch system
- Power and light on different levels
- Contingency procedure
- New characters and alien race

boardgame.name: Galaxia
boardgame.description:
Card game based on the solar system.
This a variant of the French Tarot. Like tarot, it could be played as a team with 4 or 5 player (teams change at each round). The player with the most points after some rounds, wins the game.

boardgame.name: Pages of Virtue
boardgame.description:
user summary:
An extensive sourcebook for ecclesiastic characters in Mystara. Covers clerics, healers, paladins, druids, shamans, and mystics. Also offers expanded rules for various aspects of ecclesiastic roleplaying: spells, churches, mythology, etc.

boardgame.name: צ'יקן (Chicken)
boardgame.description:
A variant of L.L.A.M.A.

Differences include:

7 of each card instead of 8.
Lower player count. 5 instead of 6.
The game is over when a player reaches 50 points instead of 40.
An additional single wild card. When played, it counts as 1 higher than the top card. When scoring, its value is equal to the last-played card.
No tokens. Players must provide their own score-keeping method.
Instead of returning tokens, a player who plays all their cards rolls two dice, which determine how many points are reduced from the score. The dice have the values 1,2,3,4,5,10. Your score can't go below 0.


—user summary

boardgame.name: Bad Asses
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Bad Asses is a book for Game Masters mostly. If a GM needs a bad guy to throw at his or her players, the GM has only to open the book and wham, instant bad guy ready for action. The players need some help with a bad guy they can't handle, open the book and BAM, help for your players.

boardgame.name: Charlemagne's Knights
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the summer of 809 AD a new and terrible force entered the world. Deep in the Pyrenees Mountains between France and Spain, a mystical portal opened up, linking the Earth to one of the many worlds of the Gromler Empire. Through this portal marched the greatest army the world has ever seen. Many tens of thousands of Gromler soldiers poured through the portal, supported by their massive armored tanks, each nearly as big a fortress. Supporting this mighty army were also hundreds of Gromler Wizards, the best of which used mystical powers like the greatest of sorcerors. The Gromler army possessed many military wonders, such as steam driven tanks, sophisticated guns, explosive grenades and worse. Charlemagne’s local barons and the military garrisons they could field were no match for this great force as the Gromler army quickly spread north and south out of the mountains.

boardgame.name: Detroit Citybook
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The city of Detroit is in trouble. The people are under attack from Canada on a daily basis. But they don’t seem to care, because they are under the sway of Hoi. Hoi is a mad magician who has the Mayor as his personal zombie and Detroiters as his banks. Most of the people do what Hoi and the city says. However there are a few out there who can resist and fight back. But the ones that can resist are not heroes (for the most part), they are villains. The Purple Gang run what the city doesn’t. They not only fight the city but the occasional gang that wants in on their action. Outside the city limits is a different story; they have to stop invasions from the City, The Purple Gang and Canadian troops. While technically a law-abiding city in the US, Detroit is trying to expand its boarders. If it can expand its boarders Hoi can gather more followers. Hoi can only influence those that live in the city limits. So if the city can swallow another smaller city on its boarders Hoi can gain more followers and he can become richer. You see Hoi isn’t in this for power; he’s in it for the money. The people of Detroit pay a high tax rate, 79%. And they love to pay this much in taxes, they love the Mayor and they love Hoi with their vary lives. The Mayor has a salary of over $10,000,000 a year. This “salary” he hands over to his master, Hoi.

boardgame.name: Lords of Order
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Lords of Order cannot normally enter this dimension: the Lords are prevented from entering this dimension by a barrier placed there by Mosses in his secret war against both the Lords of Chaos and Order. However, the Lords of Order and Chaos may still effect change on the Earth. While the physical being that is the Lord of Order cannot enter the Heroes Forever dimension, they can still act through their magical helmets. The Lords of Order are anchored to another dimension and the helmets are the only way they can travel outside that dimension. When a person puts on one of these helmets the Lord takes over that person’s body. This person is called a vassal, the vassal and the Lord come to know each other very well as the Lord is able to know what the vassal knows, however, the vassal doesn’t know what the Lord knows. The vassals are the eyes and ears of the Lords on Earth.

boardgame.name: Supernatural
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The supernatural are what normal people call ghosts, poltergeists, Grey Ghosts, banshee, skeletons, mummies, wraiths, zombies, ghouls, lichs and the like. In the sections below we will go through the stats and what it takes to become a supernatural being (most of the time it means death).

boardgame.name: Heroes Forever RPG Introductory PDF Edition
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The Heroes Forever RPG Introductory PDF Edition is part quick start and part simplified core rules, presenting the pieces of the full game needed to start and play a beginning campaign. The document assumes the reader is familiar with basic roleplaying processes.

The book unfortunately does not have a table of contents or an index.

boardgame.name: Hearts of Stone
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four to six characters of level 7

To worship the Threshold Goddess is to seek hidden knowledge in secret places. That pursuit is never easy. For some, it is fatal.

Virna Dudavre was one such victim of the goddess’s caprice. Following the dreams and portents of her patron, the dwarven warlock lived a lonely life of toil, picking out a series of tunnels and chambers in an isolated, iron-poor hillside.

She sought to break through the barrier between worlds, chipping away at the layers of strata that separate realities. What she did not know was that her calling was a competition. There was another follower of the Threshold Goddess on the other side, and she was racing to break through first.

boardgame.name: Bloody Jenny's Gambit
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four to six characters of level 4

A remote temple. A mysterious oracle. Travelers and pilgrims return changed, but is this from their glimpse of the future or due to some darker plot?

Thus the stage is set for adventure.

The party discovers all the perpetrators of a rash of crimes tied to a cult called the Red Blades recently journeyed to a remote temple to consult the reclusive oracle Morjiana Tythia. Unbeknownst to the adventurers, or even the oracle, the temple fell months ago to Bloody Jenny Baba, a night hag, and her cabal of doppelgangers. Using a magical crystal to observe the oracle’s visitors, the doppelgangers assume their forms and murder these unfortunate victims. The adventure begins when the characters approach the isolated temple.

boardgame.name: Star System Set: Frentellis Prime
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The primary star of the Frentellis AB binary star system is a destination system, not only for shipping companies exploiting the lush agricultural planet of Frentellis 4, but also the pirates and raiders that prey upon their convoys. Further crowding the shipping lanes are living ships: bioships that easily host alien crews, oftentimes integrating their technology into their organic structures. These ships, normally shepherded by a race known as the wranglers, provide additional cargo capacity for the greedy shipping concerns of the Frentellis Prime Consortium.

This stand-alone star system set integrates well with The Breakers' Yard (Frentellis B) star system set as well as the first-level adventure: Earl Grey, Hot for those groups wishing to spend more gaming time in this sector.

Included in this star system set:

Alien Race: The Wranglers
Planet: The Frentellis Prime System
Monsters: Implantacle, Plasmacroc, Rogue Antibody
Character Options: New Archetype: Bonded Pilot; New Spells: Befriend Ship, Junkbot Armor
Equipment: Bioships: Expansion bays, Lifecycles, Ship designs, and notes on running un-crewed (wild) and crewed (Including PCs) living ships.
Mini-Adventure: The Deep End of the Pool

boardgame.name: Star System Set: Breaker's Yard
Star System Set: Frentellis B "The Breaker's Yard"
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The lesser of two stars in a binary system, Frentellis B suffered a system-wide disaster shortly after the broadcast of the Signal. The indigenous race, the crustecar, long at war with the wranglers and living ships of Frentellis Prime, were saved only by the return of colonists from nearby systems. The reduced clans have staked claims in the debris belt orbiting the star, now augmented by thousands of derelict ships of all stamps and technologies, continually refreshed by the ongoing Drift anomaly. This graveyard of ships, a scavenger's utopia, is known as The Breakers' Yard.

Included in this star system set

Alien Race: The Crustecar
Planet: The Frentellis B System
Monsters: Crustecar Mechanic, Gleaning Germ, Hermit Reliquarian (kasatha technomancer)
Character Options: New Themes: Deceiver and Saboteur, New Feats: Autotomic Limbs and Junk Modder
Equipment: Clever tools for space pirates and hijackers including boarding pods and cutters, false distress signal emitters and weapons that drain shipborne life support systems. Two new crustecarian starship designs
Mini-Adventure: The Last Grove of Graska A powerful fey guides the PCs to a magical portal on the shattered remains of a blasted planet.

boardgame.name: Junction
boardgame.description:
Junction (ジャンクション) is a puzzle video game.

Using a variety of sliding puzzles, the player rolls a ball along tracks set on tiles. Players must align the tracks together and make the ball roll over bridged tracks, set on the border of the puzzle in order to complete each level. Junction has a total of 50 levels.

The Sega Game Gear version had a reference to Curse, a previous Micronet game, in its opening.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Junction_%28video_game%29 Junction (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Nemesis: Historias No Contadas 2
Nemesis: Histories Interdites #2
Nemesis: Nieznane Historie #2
Nemesis: Untold Stories #2
Nemesis: Verschwiegene Geschichten #2

Untold Stories #2 provides several additional semi co-op game scenarios for Nemesis. They are presented in a graphic-novel/comic-book style, over 80+ full-color pages.


80+ A5 pages

A lot of additional gameplay.

boardgame.name: Vitoria 1813: The Battle for Spain – Six Wargame Scenarios for General d'Armee
boardgame.description:
Vitoria, 1813, The Battle for Spain is a scenario supplement for General d’Armee.
Provides six iconic actions from decisive encounter at Vitoria in 1813, including

The combat at Osma,
the battle for the Puebla heights,
the fight for the hill at Arinez,
the battle for the Zadorra bridges,
the fight for La Hermandad and
the final assault on the main French position at Vitoria.


This 45 page PDF contains an illustrated historical introduction to the campaign followed by six scenarios which are easily printed out for the game you wish to play and contain complete army lists with unit and commander ratings as well as deployment notes and a breakdown of the terrain. WHat’s more the six scenarios can be played individually or as part of a campaign, with the result of each scenario affecting the next.

If you are looking to game this iconic campaign that sealed the fate, and liberty, of Spain then look no further.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: General d'Armee: Wargame Rules for Battles in the Age of Napoleon

boardgame.name: Until the Frost Comes
boardgame.description:
Until the Frost Comes is a solo roll-and-write game of mapping your new domain of the Autumn Court.

You are the latest ruler of the Fairie Autumn Court, trying to build up your reputation by enchanting humans foolish enough to venture into your lands; protecting your borders against the Summer and Winter Courts with brambles; and decorating the land with pumpkins, apples, and festively colored leaves to make it feel autumnal.

Of course, not everyone in the Autumn Court wants you to succeed... Puck, Tricksters, Redcaps, Changelings, and the Wild Hunt all work against you, trying to ruin your plans!

During each of the 13 turns, roll 5 six-sided dice, consult the chart for rolls of singles, doubles, or triples going through the dice from lowest to highest, then choose any hex you'd like, and using a pencil draw what the chart says in that hex. At the end of the game, tally each type of item you have drawn on the map to get your score.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mythic Coins Card Game
boardgame.description:
Mythic Coins Card Gameis a player vs player game where you control a mythic character such as a God, Goddess, or other powerful being. Each character comes in their own Coin Deck.

A Coin Deck contains a coin, display stand, dice, and 108 cards themed to that character.

There is no shuffling or drawing cards. Players use the cards to build their character based on their vision of that character and strategy for the game. A character can be customized to various power levels in the areas of Attack, Defense, Damage Bonus, Resistance, Health, Power, and Ability Cards.

There are over 50 unique Ability cards. Players secretly choose a set number of Ability cards before the game. These are kept in a player's hand and only shown when used. Most Ability cards require a specific amount of Power cards.

During a player's turn, they can choose to Activate a Character, Rest a Character, or Use a Card. Most cards result in a battle with another character. Some cards have other effects.

A player must protect their Health cards and manage their Power cards while attacking and defending against an enemy. Many attacks are resolved by opposing dice rolls. However, other attacks/defenses are countered by your opponent's cards.

There is no board. The coin is placed on its display stand in front of the player. The cards are placed next to the coin.

There is no limit to the number of players. You can play in teams, a handicapped game, or other game modes.

Game balance is maintained since each deck has cards with the same abilities. However, they are themed to fit the character. An evasion defense may be called Flight for a Dragon but Teleportation for a Lich.

Every card has a counter. More powerful cards cost more to use. You can only use an Ability card once. These things prevent one or two cards from dominating the game.

When not playing, coins can be used as display pieces since they come with a stand.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Make Muster
boardgame.description:
This race to mutual connection / sudden death cut-off game, is based on an unusual forced-to-place vs free-to-move mechanism: - If you can place an unconnected piece, you must. Otherwise you move a piece toward achieving your goal.

You must balance finding ways to place enough pieces by opening up spaces, quickly making diagonal connections, and slowing down or cutting-off the opponent at the edges with tight connections; all the while not getting cut-off yourself.

Play is optimised for the jagged-edged Muster boards, in a choice of sizes:
#2 short filler / bar game, 3-12 min
#3 tactical filler game, 8 - 25 min
#4 tactical strategy game, 15 - 45 min
#5 abstract strategy game suitable for competitions, 25-90 min
#6 hard core 40 min++

There will be other games in this series using the Muster board, including Muster Up which is a simpler connection game with jumping moves.

boardgame.name: Nirvana Yuga
boardgame.description:
Fate Legends: Indian Myths

From the introduction:

It is the world at it’s best and it’s worst that you find under this moonlit sky tonight. A time when legendary heroes battle both terrible demons for just causes and each other for petty reasons. The Gods walk the world in spirit form, far from having faded, while mere mortals seek a new path to truth. The legends of India in ancient times will be your company for your time here. The stories of the Mahabharata, the Ramayana, of Hindu myth and religion are brought to life before your very eyes.

boardgame.name: DOOM Eternal
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Against all the evil that Hell can conjure, all the wickedness that mankind can produce... We will send unto them... Only you.

Rip and tear until it is done

boardgame.name: Inn0cence: Lost Future
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The end of the world has come and gone. Life goes on. Humanity picks over the ruins and slowly tries to rebuild, but they are no longer alone.

Autonomous machines share the Lost Future with homo sapiens. New to freedom, guileless, and inquisitive, these emergent sentients are in their infancy as a race, but they learn quickly. Already they repair themselves, improve their hardware and software, and nurture divergent quirks. Relations between the two are strained, and Free Machines face suspicion and accusation as the true tale of the Loss fades from memory.

The suspicion is not unwarranted. Rumors of hostile machines spread from the north. Swift, deadly constructs out of an elder's fireside tale, killing or, sometimes, capturing human and machine alike. A scattered humanity arms itself for a battle the machines are already fighting. Remorseless contraptions of death stalk the fallow fields and ruined cities yet again, guided by a singular intelligence that brooks no dissent. The those who stand against it call it Network.

Welcome to the Lost Future.

User summary:

Inn0cence: Lost Future assumes complete familiarity with Storyteller and uses that system as a default; the product is more concerned with establishing a particular setting and style.

The rules were developed on a public forum by various interested users, and are considered open to revision (though they have been stable since abt 2018).

boardgame.name: Machine: The Abandoned
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

What is Life? Is it rushing blood, muscle and bone and straining tendon? But at the most basic cellular level, molecules snap and twist, clicking like clockwork. The search for an animating vitae, a “life force,” was called off long ago.

What is Mind? Is it sparking axon and firing synapse, flavored by a bath of hormones as it passes that infinitesimal gap? Once the Mind was thought to be a separate entity, commanding the body but of different essence. But consciousness is now know to dwell only in masses of binary tissue; the nerve either fires or it does not, One or Zero.

What is Soul? If the body is a machine and the brain a computer, then what special status can the born and grown claim over the designed and constructed? If life can be reduced to mechanistic principles, then what of the machines themselves?

Perhaps the only trait that sets the organic apart from the synthetic is Purpose. The spawn of DNA, the self-replicating things that slither and swim and crawl and walk and run and fly upon this planet have no purpose apart from survival and continuation. No maker, no design, no destiny. The device's purpose, however petty and short-sighted, is clear; the product of another being's cleverness. And though the device may spin and chirp and resemble a living thing, when its usefulness is at an end, it is cast into the trash-heap without a second thought, and it moves no more.

Because no machine, bereft of Life, of Mind, of Soul, would still strive to function after its purpose was at an end.

No machine would seek to Live.

User summary:

Machine: The Abandoned assumes complete familiarity with Storyteller and uses that system as a base unless otherwise specified. It is intended to support play in Inn0cence: Lost Future.

The rules were developed on a public forum by various interested users, and are considered open to revision (though they have been stable since abt 2018).

boardgame.name: Volo's Guide to Getting Murdered
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Volo’s Guide to Getting Murdered is your classic murder mystery adventure, complete with some political intrigue. Characters meet Volo and schmooze with some unsavoury company. Suddenly the famous author is murdered, and the real investigation begins!

boardgame.name: U.N.I.D.A. Catalog of Alternate Worlds & Platforms
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hundreds of Parallel Earths and Alien Worlds

1800+ Astounding Worlds to Explore

Since its creation in 1983 Fringeworthy has been a unique game of high adventure across Parallel Earths and Other Worlds. You will find 1800 Alternate Earths here as well as a huge number of adventure nuggets to develop. Remember, we just did the platforms from - 100 to +100 and the rest are yours to populate and explore.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

boardgame.name: Huradicator
boardgame.description:
The Machines are Alive and Humanity is the Target

Science Fiction Role Playing in the Machine Apocalypse

From the introduction:

Welcome to the Not So Far Future where Machines and Humanity wage a bloody war of survival.

This is the chronicle of that war where humanity united against a common enemy. As the machines wake and began the wholesale extermination and enslavement of man... unlikely heroes rose to mee tthe challenge and take back the world.

You are human ...and you will survive.
...
Huradicator originally premiered as a Fringeworthy Tournament.

User summary:

Huradicator originally was written for Fringeworthy. It is here adapted to the EZ Rules system which, effectively, means it's easily adaptable to any rule system - primarily by having very few statistics or other mechanics requirements.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

boardgame.name: Noir Spelpaket
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb (in Swedish):

Noir Spelpaket är en gedigen arkivmapp som innehåller allt en Noir-spelgrupp behöver. Med Spelpaketet kan en erfaren grupp uppleva Noir utan att behöva öppna regelboken under spelsessionen. All information som behövs finns tillgänglig för snabb referens. Pappmapp, över 25 artiklar!

User translation:

Noir Spelpaket (Noir Player Package) is a sturdy archive folder containing everything a Noir group needs. With the player package, adept players can experience Noir without having to open the rule book during the session. All information that is needed is available för easy reference. Cardboard folder, over 25 articles!

boardgame.name: Verkaufshit
boardgame.description: The memo game for language lovers and wordsmiths. For 2 and more players. Playing time approx. 20 min. In the new memo game for language and pun lovers, pairs like "Bär" and "Tiger" result in the noun "BÄRTIGER". "Tang" and "Ente" become "TANGENTE", the nouns "Mode" and "Rat" form the German adjective "MODERAT". This game is full of surprises and trains the exact viewing of words. Each of the 36 pairs has its own background colour, which may be used as confirmation when searching for the correct word pairs. Only language grouches rely solely on the colours when searching for the pun pairs.

boardgame.name: Versteckt! Entdeckt?
boardgame.description:
Versteckt! Entdeckt? ("Hidden! Found?") is an associative memo game full of creative and affectionately arranged picture cards. This compact memo game transforms every-day objects into faces in no time at all – or, the other way around, challenges the players to discover the oftentimes well-hidden elements in the faces. Here, spaghetti turns into an impressive head of hair, a pancake takes the shape of a face, and a belly button suddenly becomes a mouth. Hidden! Found? is the smart successor of the MeterMorphosen memo game classic What is this?, where every-day items are transformed into different animals. The artist behind both games Antje Damm has written several philosophical children's books (i.e. Frag mich!, Nichts und wieder nichts) and has earned various prizes for them.

Also available with English sleeve.

boardgame.name: Was ist das?
boardgame.description: Discovering something special in every-day life and transforming it creatively – with the new memo game What is this? and a bit of skill anyone can achieve it. With motives by the renowned children's book illustrator Antje Damm, MeterMorphosen is finally introducing a memo game for children that is more challenging than the usual memo games as its pairs consist of two different motives. When you find everyday items like carrots, a clothespin or soap on the sturdy memo cards, the question is: What is this? With the matching second card, these every-day objects are transformed into animals: a sausage becomes a dachshund, and a popsicle unexpectedly turns into a penguin. The 24 pairs of What is this? promote associative thinking and thus support intelligence development through effortless play. This memo game is not only an assembly of marvellous ideas, but also an encouragement to examine the world more closely, to get creative and to use one's imagination.

boardgame.name: StadtSpiel
boardgame.description:
StadtSpiel ("CityGame") can be played as a classical domino, but you can also try to figure out the perfect urban layout in a puzzle variant. The game is constructive fun for young and old! Domino completely different new way - because imagination and creativity, a sense for the gap and the view are required for the matching puzzle piece.

The game keeps children and adults tied up for hours, because in this domino game new streets and buildings are constructed all the time and a constantly changing city brings great joy.

boardgame.name: Eierköppe
boardgame.description: An incredibly fun memo game for adults who are interested in the history of the 20th century. Just like in other memo games, the players have to find pairs – but actually, in this game there are always four of a kind! The four Beatles: John, Paul, George, and Ringo. Or four conservatives: Angela Merkel, Mother Teresa, Pope Jean Paul, and Margaret Thatcher. It is absolutely entertaining to spot the caricatures of prominent persons in the game and to discover their independent categorization. The players get to keep both cards if they find corresponding pairs, but if they find all four cards of a kind, they get additional points via an extra joker card that raises the pile of gained cards and helps them win the game in the end. There are 64 cards in the box.

boardgame.name: Arty Mouse: Drawing game
boardgame.description:
Arty Mouse: Drawing game was developed to help pre-school children learn colours and shapes. There are two ways to play - an easier and more advanced mode.

In the Basic game mode, every child gets their own wipe-clean board. Then a card with a drawing is chosen. The goal of the game is to be the first one to draw the same drawing with the same colours.

On their turn, a child reveals a card with a shape that determines the shape they can draw. They have to choose a colour and draw all the shapes in this colour exactly as on the card. The winner is the child who completes their drawing first.

In the Advanced game mode, a die determines the colour that the child has to use to draw a shape. But if the colour does not match the original, they get fewer points. They have to decide whether to pass a turn and wait for the perfect opportunity or to get at least some points before someone else finishes their drawing first.

The rules include additional variants for a cooperative and free drawing gameplay.

— description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Arty Mouse: Spin & Find game
boardgame.description:
Arty Mouse: Spin & Find game was developed to help children strengthen their memory and practice memory techniques. There are two ways of playing it - an easier and a more advanced mode.

The game has a spinner and tiles with characters. The characters are represented on the tiles multiple times in different environments and poses. The goal of the game is to find and get as many tiles as possible.

In the basic game mode, children first mark the back of the tiles. They can draw their unique markings, shapes and doodles that will help them remember what is on the other side. The tiles are then placed face-down. In the second part of the game they spin the spinner and find the character that the arrow points to among the face-down tiles. The player with the most tiles at the end of the game wins.

In the advanced game mode, extra tiles are added, with only some tiles marked, and additional rules apply that make the game even more challenging.

The rules include additional variants for a single player and cooperative gameplay.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Baldo The guardian owls
boardgame.description:
A journey into a magical land full of mysteries to discover.

Baldo is an action adventure rpg, full of puzzles and intricate dungeons to solve.

Travelling around the world, Baldo will interact with many weird and funny characters scattered everywhere, to complete the main story quest and many other sidequests.

You’ll travel into an open world map discovering new towns and people, fighting enemies , locating hidden temples and collecting objects to get new weapons or items to use.

boardgame.name: Bounty Battle
boardgame.description: Bounty Battle is the ultimate indie fighting game: a new multiplayer 2D fighter, where you can pit your favourite indie heroes against one another!
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Yōkai: Tsurube Otoshi
boardgame.description:
Tsurube Otoshi is a goodie with rules for a new level for Yōkai.

It comes as a bottle opener and a rules card.

The Tsurube Otoshi sits on four cards that players cannot interact with on their turn. Once their turn is over, they move the Tsurube Otoshi to a new location for the next player to deal with.

boardgame.name: Tower of Samsara - Hidden Treasures
boardgame.description: Summon the forces of the Sun to face tough enemies in this hard souls-like puzzle platform 2D when a long dead Plutonian is ressurected by the primordial light of the Sun seeking for a champion to avoid its impending doom.

boardgame.name: Doko Roko
boardgame.description: Doko Roko is a 2D rogue-like, vertical action game with an emphasis on lightning-fast combat and rich atmosphere. It is currently being developed by Eric Mack, the founder of Oboku Games, a currently one-man studio. The game was recently funded on Kickstarter.

boardgame.name: The 1967 Annual
boardgame.description: The 1967 Annual is a 64 page compendium of great new content for 7TV 2nd edition. This softback book features new articles, profiles, programme guides, the new Ratings War campaign rules and stories as well as 68 new profile cards, 12 ratings war cards and 4 new Daredevils gadgets.

boardgame.name: Boss Monster: Santa Epic Hero Promo
boardgame.description: Santa Claus was created as a promo during the Digital Boss Monster Kickstarter campaign. It was released on December 24th, 2014. It is the first Hero to have 9 base Health.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Boss Monster: The Dungeon Building Card Game

boardgame.name: A War of Whispers: Dark Alliances
boardgame.description: The Dark Alliances cards start the game in the deck with the other cards. You can use these powerful cards to help one of your fellow players...for a price!

boardgame.name: Chivalry & Sorcery Character Generator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Excel Spreadsheet untility to aid in character generation for the new 5th edition Chivalry and Sorcery Rules with accompanying instructions.

boardgame.name: Grand Debut
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For My Next Trick, I'll Make My Assistant Disappear

Grand Debut is a new One Sheet by BPB Games that places players into the roles of average people looking to enjoy a night of stage magic. Suspend your disbelief, please. After watching a surprisingly impressive performance by the legendary Arturius the Astounding, things go afoul when a volunteer from the crowd disappears from a magical box and is replaced by a hulking, bloodthirsty demon! Worse yet, it's sealed the exists to ensure its prey cannot escape!

boardgame.name: Underworld Lairs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Darkness & Death in the Underworld

An encampment of the nearly extinct drow defending an Underworld entrance.
A cathedral lit by the eerie green glow of thousands of candles.
A powerful lich inhabiting the corpse of a giant petrified worm.


Inside, you’ll find these and more! The standalone, single-map adventures for characters of levels 3 to 15 will challenge players with the strange societies of the derro and darakhul, fantastical locations such as the Skullcap Forest and an outpost of the Ghoul Imperium, and powerful opposition including a clan of cave giants called the Sunseekers.

Use these as a stop along your campaign or in a single, standalone session. Whether a party of heroes or those of… flexible moral fiber, they will enjoy the struggle and triumph of these Underworld Lairs. That is, unless the cave dragon adds them to the foundation of his ziggurat of bones!

boardgame.name: Midderzine (Issue 4 - Apr 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

More Green for your game

More fodder for your ‘The Midderlands’ OSR campaign setting.

Our fourth issue!!

This is a fanzine for The Midderlands campaign setting for old school games. Although The Midderlands was written for Swords & Wizardry Complete, it works with all the old school games and retroclones with little or no conversion. Hell, you can even adopt it for any fantasy roleplaying game.
Within this issue you can find news articles, information about locations, monsters, classes, oddities, spells, and just about anything to do with the Midderlands, the Haven Isles, and further afield.

IN THIS ISSUE:

Meet the Midderlander: Mark Nolan
Rumours from the Haven Gazette
A Goman Vampire in Lunden: A new city location
The Ophenicus Villa: A building location near Shroomsbury
A New Class: Serpentist
New Monsters, Oddities, and more...

boardgame.name: Hope Travel Companion #1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hope Travel Companion is a series of narrative setting guides.

In Volume 1 you will find the experiences of a travel-weary scholar named Nicholas. Travel with him across a Southern United Wastelands of America as he retells of the dangers he experienced and details some other mutants reported to him.

Inside you will find:

9 locations
4 enemy factions, each with a Tested leader.
5 beasts and 8 plants to fight
And every page has a piece of setting lore or history. Except for the last two pages, which are a map and location key!

boardgame.name: Hope Solo Rules
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

HOPE Is about keeping the last bastion of humanity afloat in the end times.

The GMLess Toolkit allows you to run a solo game in conjunction with the HOPE rules using the ORACLE system.

boardgame.name: Rock Dread
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rock Dread was considered so minor that in its initial survey, it wasn’t even given a name, but an alphanumeric designation. By the time the designator had been bastardized into the world’s name, it was on the front lines of an interstellar war, transformed into a strategic flashpoint bristling with weapons emplacements. After the war, the interstellar government reformed the installations as prisons housing some of the worst offenders in known space. Guarded by uncaring authorities and the planet’s hostile environment, the prisons have become crucibles where only the strong survive and the few who eventually leave — legally or otherwise — take their hard-bitten attitudes with them.

Port of Call: Rock Dread introduces Cepheus Engine and Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG) players to this danger-ridden duality of a planet. Inside is an overview of how the information would appear in the PCs’ library database, physical planetary and system information, a brief history, a look at its administration, technology, and society, a quick guide to crafting characters that would hail from such a place and a diagram of one of the prison facililties.

Port of Call: Rock Dread. Dropping the soap is the least of your worries.

boardgame.name: Book of the Dead
boardgame.description:
Book of the Dead is a fast-paced co-operative card game for 2-6 players that takes 9 minutes (or less) to play. Players must work together to collect the scattered pages, place them back into the book by matching arcane symbols and close the covers in time to prevent the return of Great Cthulhu.

At the start of each player's turn, they must roll the die of the dead, and then follow the instructions of the icon rolled before they take their action. The Skull may force players to discard cards from their hand, and the Book may eject pages from the book, back to the vortex. In the basic game, the Vortex icon is not used, and represents a brief respite for the players.

Each page of the book of the dead is represented by a double sided poker-sized card (with rounded corners) that feature 1-6 arcane icons. To bring two pages together, the icons must match. On your turn, after you have rolled the dice, you have one action, such as taking a card from the Vortex (the central pool of cards in the table), adding your 'stack' of cards to the book and finally, if able, to close the book and win the game.

—description from the designer
